pageHeader.heading: People
pageHeader.text: We are a team of people bound together by a shared desire to make the world better for everyone.

people.title: Michel Al-Moumen
people.personShortBio: Michel joined Legatum in 2018 as an Investment Analyst, moving to Dubai from New York
people.personFullBiography:
Michel Al-Moumen is an Investment Analyst at Legatum, responsible for research and analysis of existing and potential holdings.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2018, Michel was a Consultant at global investment fund, Tiger Global Management, based in New York.

Michel holds an MBA in Finance and Accounting and a BScE in Finance and Real Estate at the Wharton School, and a BA in International Studies from the College of Arts and Sciences, both at the University of Pennsylvania.

people.title: Graham Alltoft
people.personShortBio: Graham joined Legatum in 2011 and is responsible for measuring the firm's impact
people.personFullBiography:
Graham is the Head of Data for Legatum, and is tasked primarily with measuring the firm's impact across its various philanthropic and mission-based activities. He joined the organisation in 2011, relocating from London to serve in roles in both the IT and Corporate Communications teams.

Graham holds a Bachelor of Science with honours from Brunel University London, a Master of Science in Software Engineering from Westminster University, and a Master of Business Administration (MBA) from Warwick Business School in the UK.

people.title: John Bastin
people.personShortBio: John Bastin serves as the Senior Cloud Engineer at Legatum, joining the firm in 2017
people.personFullBiography:
John Bastin serves as the Senior Cloud Engineer at Legatum, bringing a wealth of experience and expertise to his role. He commenced his journey with the company in 2017, initially serving as Technical Support Analyst.

Before joining Legatum, John held positions within the realm of technical support. He notably served as Technical Support Analyst at IHS Markit (now S&P Global) in London, UK, and prior to this role, John served as Senior Operations Analyst at First Data (now Fiserv).

people.title: Guy Cave
people.personShortBio: Guy joined Legatum in 2023 and is responsible for the firm’s philanthropic investments
people.personFullBiography:
Guy Cave is President of the Legatum Foundation.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2023, Guy built up 30 years of experience in social work, international development, humanitarian response, and philanthropy consulting. This included working for Geneva Global, Save the Children, and the NSPCC. Guy has lived and worked in multiple countries across five continents – including: Colombia, Myanmar (Burma), Cote d’Ivoire, Senegal, USA, Turkey etc.

He holds a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Durham; a Masters in Social Work from the University of York; and a Masters in Children’s Rights from the University of Fribourg (Switzerland).

people.title: Evita Castro
people.personShortBio: Evita joined the firm in 2021 as an Accounts Payable Accountant
people.personFullBiography:
Evita is an Accounts Payable Accountant at Legatum, joining the firm in 2021.

With a versatile background spanning Oil and Gas, Startups, and the Philanthropic sectors, she brings a wealth of experience and adaptability to her role.

Evita holds a double degree in 'Management Accounting' and 'Accounting' from the University of Santo Tomas, Manila, Philippines.

people.title: Christopher Chandler

personImage.title: Christopher Chandler: Chairman and Partner of Legatum

people.personShortBio: Christopher was the founding partner of Legatum and currently serves as Chairman
people.personFullBiography:
Christopher Chandler is the Chairman and founding partner of Legatum. He has worked with his partners to establish a number of the firm’s key philanthropic endeavours, including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, the Legatum Center for Development and Entrepreneurship at MIT, and the Legatum Institute Foundation in London.

Prior to Legatum, Christopher was the Co-Founder of the Monaco-based Sovereign Global group, which specialised in emerging-market investments for over two decades.

Christopher holds degrees in business and law from the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

people.title: Lucy Cleary
people.personShortBio: Lucy Cleary joined Legatum in 2022 as Executive Assistant to the CEO
people.personFullBiography:
Lucy Cleary joined Legatum in 2022 as Executive Assistant to Mark Stoleson, CEO.

Prior to joining Legatum, Lucy worked at Deutsche Bank AG, in London, where her roles included Global Events Coordinator and Executive Assistant to the Vice Chairman of Wealth Management.

Lucy brings a wealth of experience across areas including event management, administrative support, and international business operations.

She is committed to supporting the CEO and advancing the mission of Legatum to drive positive change and prosperity worldwide.

people.title: Gage Eller
people.personShortBio: Since joining Legatum, Gage now serves as an Associate in Group Investments
people.personFullBiography:
Since joining Legatum in 2023 as a Junior Associate General Counsel, Gage Eller now serves as an Associate in Group Investments, where he is responsible for using his legal background to critically analyse and solve for challenges arising across the company.

Prior to Legatum, Gage served as a Judicial Law Clerk for the Honourable Cory T. Wilson at the United States Court of Appeal for the Fifth Circuit, and the Honourable Mark. T. Pittman at the United States District Court for the Northern District of Texas.

Gage holds a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Iowa and a Juris Doctor from the Pepperdine University Caruso School of Law.

people.title: Jason Gallimore
people.personShortBio: Jason Gallimore is a Senior IT Security Engineer at Legatum
people.personFullBiography:
Jason Gallimore is a Senior IT Security Engineer at Legatum.

Prior to joining Legatum, Jason worked in the IT team at Lloyds Banking Group and a variety of organisations in London's financial sector.

Jason holds a Bachelor's Degree with distinction in Computing Studies from London South Bank University.

people.title: Sarah Hilton
people.personShortBio: Sarah joined Legatum in 2017 as an Executive Assistant before assuming her role as Paralegal
people.personFullBiography:
Having moved to Dubai in 2017, Sarah joined Legatum the same year as an Executive Assistant before assuming her role as Paralegal.

Sarah works closely with the Legal Counsel to provide legal support and assistance across a range of functions, contributing to the effective operation of the legal department within Legatum.

Prior to moving to Dubai, Sarah was educated at the University of Leeds following which she gained significant experience in various roles working for global corporations and private families.

people.title: Maria Horning
people.personShortBio: Maria joined Legatum in 2023 with a focus on the firm’s character-based leadership initiatives
people.personFullBiography:
Maria is the Vice President for Leadership Development of Legatum Foundation.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2023, Maria was an independent leadership development consultant, a Senior Program Director at Geneva Global, a philanthropic consulting firm, and a Business Analyst at Headwaters SC.

Maria holds a Masters in Organisational Development and Leadership from St. Joseph’s University and a Bachelor of Arts in Economic Development from Eastern University.

people.title: Evie Lelliott
people.personShortBio: Evie joined Legatum in 2021 and is the firm's Human Potential Manager
people.personFullBiography:
In 2021, Evie joined Legatum as an Executive Assistant before assuming her role as Human Potential Manager.

In this capacity, Evie plays a pivotal role in fostering a culture of growth, honour, and excellence within the organisation. Evie collaborates closely with leaders across Legatum to implement innovative strategies that align with Legatum's mission and values.

people.title: Matt Linnell
people.personShortBio: Matt Linnell is the Associate General Counsel at Legatum, joining the firm in 2023
people.personFullBiography:
Matt Linnell is the Associate General Counsel at Legatum. Matt covers all legal matters across Legatum, including public and private M&A, litigation, intellectual property, contracts, tax, and general legal support of Legatum’s philanthropic initiatives.

Prior to Legatum, Matt was a commercial litigator in the Los Angeles offices of two international law firms. He holds a BBA in Finance and BA in Journalism from Baylor University and a JD from Pepperdine University School of Law. He is a member of the State Bar of California.

people.title: David Matthew
people.personShortBio: David joined Legatum in 2012 as Head of Trading after working in Europe for several years
people.personFullBiography:
David Matthew is the Head of Trading at Legatum.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2012, David was the Head of Trading at Montrica Investment Management and the Head of European Trading at TPG-Axon Capital Management. David also worked in various roles at Caxton Europe Asset Management and Deutsche Bank.

David holds a BA in Economics from the University of California-Irvine and is a CFA Charterholder.

people.title: Alan McCormick
people.personShortBio: Alan co-founded Legatum, driving the creation of much of the firm's social investment portfolio
people.personFullBiography:
Alan McCormick is a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 serving in various capacities with a wide range of management responsibilities across the group. He was formerly part of Legatum’s predecessor, Sovereign Asset Management, and a member of its special situations team.

Alan, along with his Partners, has driven the incubation of much of Legatum’s social investment portfolio where he also plays a governance role for organisations including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, the Legatum Center for Entrepreneurship at MIT and the Legatum Institute Foundation which is based in London.

people.title: Anna McGuire
people.personShortBio: Anna joined Legatum's Finance team in 2021 as an Accounts Payable Accountant
people.personFullBiography:
Anna joined Legatum's Finance team in 2021 as an Accounts Payable Accountant.

Prior to joining Legatum, Anna was an Assistant Accountant at IrishLife, based in Dublin. Anna holds a Bachelor’s degree in Finance & French from the University of Limerick in Ireland and later studied 'Business' in the city of Toulouse in the South of France.

Anna is currently expanding her accounting expertise by studying for her Chartered Certified Accountancy exams. She is also pursuing an MBA with a specialisation in Business & Data Analytics at the University of Abertay, Scotland.

people.title: Caroline McLean
people.personShortBio: Caroline McLean is an Executive Assistant at Legatum, having joined the firm in 2021
people.personFullBiography:
Caroline McLean is an Executive Assistant at Legatum, having joined the firm in 2021.

Caroline has over 17 years’ experience working in the Middle East and previously served as an Executive Assistant to the Chief Legal Officer and Legal Team at Al Tayer Group.

people.title: Dakota Morrell
people.personShortBio: Dakota joined Legatum in 2020 as an Investment Analyst, moving from J.P. Morgan in New York
people.personFullBiography:
Dakota Morrell is an Investment Analyst at Legatum, responsible for helping Legatum Capital with research and investment diligence.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2020, Dakota was an Investment Banking Analyst at J.P. Morgan, based in New York.

Dakota holds a Bachelor’s Degree with Distinction in Commerce from the University of Virginia, McIntire School of Commerce.

people.title: Prakash Naik
people.personShortBio: Prakash has been our in-house Café Manager at Legatum since 2006
people.personFullBiography:
Prakash has been our in-house Café Manager at Legatum since its inception.

Originally from India, he came to Dubai in search of a prosperous future for himself and his family.

people.title: Hayley Nolan
people.personShortBio: Hayley joined Legatum in 2024 and oversees the Front of House within the Operations team
people.personFullBiography:
Hayley joined Legatum in 2024 and oversees the Front of House within the Operations team.

Hayley’s role includes creating an environment that reflects the company’s core values by building a space of excellence and elegance, whilst working closely with key members of staff to ensure the smooth running of the Operations team.

people.title: Conor O'Flynn

personImage.title: Conor O Flynn MCV0469 for website

people.personShortBio: Conor joined Legatum in 2009, working in various roles before taking up his position as Head of IT
people.personFullBiography:
Conor O’Flynn is the Head of IT at Legatum. He has served in various capacities at the firm, including Technical Support Analyst, Senior Technical Analyst and Senior IT Project Manager.

Prior to Legatum, Conor was an IT Support Specialist at Siemens IT Solutions and Sales Executive at Mediasatellite in Ireland.

He holds a Bachelor’s degree in IT Services Management from Cork Institute of Technology and a National Diploma in Information Technology from the Waterford Institute of Technology. He is further certified in CCSP, CISSP and ITIL v3.

people.title: Sarah O'Sullivan
people.personShortBio: Sarah joined Legatum in 2023 and holds the position of Team Assistant
people.personFullBiography:
Sarah joined Legatum in 2023, supporting the Operations team. She now holds the position of Team Assistant, primarily providing administrative support to the Finance team.

Prior to joining Legatum, Sarah was an Assistant HR Manager at FBD Hotels and Resorts, and an Onboarding Associate at CluneTech, in Ireland.

She holds a Master of Business (MBS) and a Bachelor of Business (Honours), specialising in Human Resource Management from Waterford Institute of Technology.

people.title: Crystal Pais
people.personShortBio: Crystal Pais is the Financial Controller at Legatum, having joined the firm in 2013
people.personFullBiography:
Crystal Pais is the Financial Controller at Legatum. Since joining in 2013, she has served the firm in various capacities, with a main focus on cost control, management reporting and taxation.

Prior to joining Legatum, she was an auditor with Sharp & Tannan, based in Mumbai.

Crystal is a Chartered Accountant with the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. She also holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree from the University of Mumbai.

people.title: Ana Ross
people.personShortBio: Ana joined Legatum in 2021 and is a part of the Finance Team, serving as Middle Office Associate
people.personFullBiography:
Ana joined Legatum in 2021 as a Middle Office Associate and supports the Capital Markets team on investment operations. She also collaborates on various functions and projects within the Finance Team.

Ana holds a Master of Finance Degree with Distinction from RMIT University in Melbourne, Australia, and is an Affiliate of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA). She is currently pursuing the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation.

Prior to joining Legatum and transitioning into Finance, Ana lived in London and pursued a medical career. She also holds a Bachelor of Medical Science from LaTrobe University and has worked on various medical research projects at St Vincent’s and The Royal Melbourne Hospitals, Australia.

people.title: Imran Sheikh
people.personShortBio: Imran is part of Legatum's Operations team, joining the firm in 2014
people.personFullBiography:
Imran is part of Legatum's Operations team, joining the firm in 2014. He serves as both an administrative assistant and a driver.

Before joining Legatum, Imran spent many years behind the wheel as a chauffeur, showcasing his love for driving and his commitment to his profession. In his spare time, he enjoys playing football and cricket, indulging his passion for sports whenever he can.

people.title: Charlotte Smith
people.personShortBio: Charlotte Smith joined Legatum in 2024 as an Executive Assistant within the Capital Markets team
people.personFullBiography:
Charlotte Smith joined Legatum in 2024 as an Executive Assistant within the Capital Markets team.

Prior to joining Legatum, Charlotte worked for the CEO of an investment firm in DIFC. Before moving to Dubai, she worked as an Executive Assistant at Goldman Sachs in London, where she supported a Partner within Global Markets.

people.title: Mark Stoleson
people.personShortBio: Mark co-founded Legatum with his partners in 2006 and now serves as Chief Executive Officer
people.personFullBiography:
Mark Stoleson is the Chief Executive Officer and a Partner of Legatum.

He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 and has served in various capacities including Head of Group Investments. Mark has worked with his partners at Legatum to incubate a number of the firm’s key philanthropic endeavours including the END Fund, Freedom Fund, Luminos Fund, The Legatum Center for Development and Entrepreneurship at MIT, and the Legatum Institute Foundation in London.

Prior to Legatum, Mark was a corporate finance and M&A attorney with Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld.

He holds a BA in International Relations from Occidental College and a JD-LLM from Duke University School of Law.

people.title: Manoj Subrahmanian
people.personShortBio: Manoj has been part of Legatum's Operations team since 2006
people.personFullBiography:
Manoj has been with Legatum since its inception in 2006.

His commitment to both his professional life at Legatum and his family reflects a well-balanced life. He says he has found a sense of belonging and fulfilment at the firm.

people.title: Haulwen Thomas
people.personShortBio: Haulwen joined Legatum in 2012 and holds the position of Operations Manager
people.personFullBiography:
Haulwen Thomas is the Operations Manager at Legatum. During her time at Legatum she has served in various capacities including Operations Assistant.

Prior to Legatum, Haulwen was an Executive Assistant at the Chalhoub Group in Dubai and a Claims Manager at the Admiral Group in Wales.

people.title: Aradhana Uppal
people.personShortBio: Aradhana is an Accountant, joining Legatum in 2011
people.personFullBiography:
Aradhana Uppal is an Accountant at Legatum.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2011, Aradhana was a Financial Reporting Analyst at HSBC, Dubai.

Aradhana holds a Diploma in Economics and a Bachelor of Science in Banking & Finance from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

people.title: Rosemarie Uy Magsino
people.personShortBio: Rosemarie Uy Magsino joined the firm in 2016 and is the Head of Middle Office at Legatum
people.personFullBiography:
Since joining Legatum in 2016, Rosemarie has played various roles in different functions within the Finance team, focusing on Capital Markets and Private Family Office support, finance systems and banking relationships.

Prior to joining Legatum, she was the Assistant Vice President of Treasury & Investment Operations at QInvest LLC, one of the leading investment banks in Qatar. During her time at Deutsche Knowledge Services, she worked in various finance roles in Deutsche Bank offices in Manila, Sydney, London and New York. She was also an Auditor at KPMG Philippines.

Rosemarie is a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) from the Philippines and holds a Certificate of Investment Operations from the Chartered Institute of Securities and Investments (CISI) in London.

She graduated as Magna Cum Laude for her degree in Bachelor of Science in Accountancy from Manuel S. Enverga University Foundation in the Philippines.

people.title: Philip Vassiliou
people.personShortBio: Philip co-founded Legatum. He leads the investment team and is also Chair of the Luminos Fund
people.personFullBiography:
Philip Vassiliou is the Chief Investment Officer and a Partner of Legatum. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2006 and is primarily responsible for the oversight of Legatum’s capital markets activities. Philip is also Chair of the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative founded by Legatum which is dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world’s most vulnerable children.

Prior to Legatum, Philip previously worked for the Dubai Development Investment Authority, and in the Equities & Private Wealth divisions of Goldman Sachs in New York and London.

Philip holds a Bachelor of Science from Babson College.

people.title: Rob Vickers
people.personShortBio: Rob joined Legatum in 2011 as General Counsel and sits on the Legatum Institute's board
people.personFullBiography:
Rob Vickers is the General Counsel at Legatum. Rob currently serves on the Legatum Institute's Board of Trustees and was on the first Board of Directors for the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world’s most vulnerable children.

Prior to Legatum, Rob was a General Corporate Attorney in the London and Dubai offices of an international law firm, with a focus on private equity, corporate restructurings and public and private M&A.

He holds a degree in Law, LLB, from King’s College, London and the College of Law and is a member of the Law Society of England & Wales.

people.title: Carla Viedge
people.personShortBio: Carla is Chief Financial Officer at Legatum, joining the firm in 2008
people.personFullBiography:
Carla Viedge is the Chief Financial Officer at Legatum and is responsible for the Group’s finance function. She joined the firm in 2008 and has served in various capacities in the Finance team.

Carla has over 20 years of experience in the finance industry in both the UK and the Middle East. Prior to Legatum, Carla started her career in London working as an Accountant for the British Royal Family’s Private Office and Hitachi. Carla is an Associate Member and Chartered Management Accountant with the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants in the United Kingdom. She holds a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Stellenbosch in South Africa, where she majored in Law.

people.title: Samantha Wakeham
people.personShortBio: Samantha joined Legatum in 2019 and serves as the firm's Events Coordinator
people.personFullBiography:
In 2019, Samantha joined Legatum initially serving as an Operations Assistant before transitioning into her current role as Events Coordinator. Prior to her tenure at Legatum, Sam gained valuable experience working with organisations such as Emirates and PricewaterhouseCoopers.

In her current capacity, Sam plays a pivotal role in planning and executing high-profile events across the Legatum Group, exemplifying the firm's principles of Excellence and Elegance. She embodies Legatum's culture of honour, fostering meaningful connections within the firm and network to create engagement opportunities with our philanthropic programmes.

people.title: Colin Webb
people.personShortBio: Colin joined Legatum in 2006 and serves as Legatum's COO
people.personFullBiography:
Colin Webb is the Chief Operating Officer at Legatum.

Since joining Legatum in 2006, Colin has served in various capacities, including Senior Vice President of Legatum Foundation, Digital Director, and served on the Board of Directors for the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative founded by Legatum dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world's most vulnerable children.

Prior to Legatum, Colin was a Systems Analyst at MarketDeveloper in London, United Kingdom, and before that was a Web Developer at MWEB, one of South Africa's largest internet service providers.

He holds a BSc in IT Management and Computer Science from the University of South Africa and an Executive Master of Business Administration (MBA) from Cass Business School.

people.title: Imran Weldingwala
people.personShortBio: Imran joined Legatum in 2024 as a Research Analyst
people.personFullBiography:
Imran Weldingwala is a Research Analyst at Legatum, responsible for research and investment diligence.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2024, Imran was an Investment Banking Analyst at Evercore, based in London. Imran holds a First Class Bachelor’s Degree in Philosophy, Politics, and Economics from the University of Warwick.

people.title: Charlotte Wilson
people.personShortBio: Charlotte joined Legatum in 2019, serving as the Executive Assistant to the CIO and COO
people.personFullBiography:
Charlotte joined Legatum in 2019, serving as the Executive Assistant to the Capital Market team. She now provides support to Philip Vassiliou, CIO, and Colin Webb, COO.

Prior to joining Legatum, Charlotte held the position of Legal Support Manager, where she specialised in cultivating relationships and enhancing team workflows - skills she has seamlessly integrated into her current role at Legatum.

people.title: Gene White
people.personShortBio: Joining the firm in 2023, Gene White is Senior Vice President of Legatum Foundation
people.personFullBiography:
Gene White is Senior Vice President of the Legatum Foundation.

Prior to joining Legatum in 2023, Gene spent the last 20 years working in the philanthropic, non-profit, and international relief and development sectors. Gene’s experience includes overseeing programmes in multiple countries in Asia, Africa, and the Middle East, across a variety of sectors including community health, disaster recovery, education, and human liberty. Although Gene only joined Legatum in 2023, he has a long history with, and deep knowledge of, Legatum’s philanthropy, having worked for 15 years at Geneva Global (which was previously Legatum’s philanthropy partner). In this role, Gene was actively involved in supporting the launch and set up of collaborative philanthropic funds, including the Freedom Fund and Luminos Fund.

Gene holds a bachelor's degree from the University of Maryland and a master's degree from Wheaton College.

people.title: Caitlin Baron
people.personShortBio: Caitlin has led The Luminos Fund as CEO since it was first established by Legatum in 2016
people.personRole: Chief Executive Officer of the Luminos Fund
people.personFullBiography:
Caitlin is the inaugural Chief Executive Officer of the Luminos Fund, a philanthropic initiative dedicated to advancing education innovations for the world’s most vulnerable children. Luminos believes in the power of creative pedagogies and activity-based education to transform children’s lives in the poorest corners of the world.

Prior to the Luminos Fund, Caitlin served as a senior leader within the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, helping to grow the organisation to steward over $1 billion in charitable giving. She founded and led the foundation’s office in South Africa and built MSDF’s impact investing portfolio.

Caitlin holds a degree in Political Science from UCLA and is pursuing an Executive Masters with the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts University.

people.title: Nick Grono
people.personShortBio: Nick is CEO of the Freedom Fund. He has led the fund since it was established in 2014
people.personRole: Chief Executive Officer of the Freedom Fund
people.personFullBiography:
Nick Grono is the inaugural Chief Executive Officer of the Freedom Fund, an ambitious effort to mobilise the knowledge, capital and will needed to end modern slavery. Nick is also a board member of Girls Not Brides: the Global Partnership to End Child Marriage, and was previously the Chair of the Jo Cox Foundation.

Prior to the Freedom Fund, Nick was the inaugural Chief Executive Officer of the Walk Free Foundation, and the Deputy President and Chief Operating Officer of the International Crisis Group (ICG). Nick is a lawyer by background and, prior to ICG, was Chief of Staff and National Security Adviser to the Australian Attorney-General.

He holds a law degree, LLB, with first class honours from the University of Sydney and a Master’s in Public Policy from Princeton University.

people.title: Dr Radomir Tylecote
people.personShortBio: Radomir joined Legatum Institute in 2023 as its Managing Director.
people.personRole: Managing Director of the Legatum Institute
people.personFullBiography:
Radomir rejoined Legatum Institute in 2023 as Managing Director.

Prior to that, Radomir was Special Adviser to Rt Hon Jacob Rees-Mogg MP as Minister for Brexit Opportunities and Government Efficiency, then Business Secretary.

Previously at the Legatum Institute and Institute of Economic Affairs he published some of the most influential think-tank publications in the last decade.

Radomir co-authored the book Plan A+: creating a prosperous post-Brexit UK, lauded as the free-trading, pro-sovereignty Brexiteer alternative to the Chequers White Paper, which planned regulatory alignment with the EU.

The most publicised think-tank release in British history and launched live on two TV channels, the book announced the return of Britain as a free-trade nation: described by the Telegraph as having “moved the centre of gravity in the Conservative Party” and by one cabinet minister as “vital to the course of Brexit history”. Boris Johnson quoted from Plan A+ in his first speech as Prime Minister on Britain’s new course as an independent, free-trading nation. The book was also the subject of an eighteen-month campaign of illegal censorship by a major regulator, which has since apologised and the episode has become a test case in the modern suppression of free speech.

His other publications include Inadvertently Arming China?: The Chinese military complex and its potential exploitation of scientific research at UK universities. This investigation into the funding of British university research centres by Chinese military-linked organisations demonstrated for the first time their research outputs in military-applicable fields. Making international front-page news, the paper was the subject of a major BBC documentary.

Radomir is a regular public speaker and often published in the Telegraph, Express, Spectator and elsewhere. He has been a speech-writer to a foreign former Prime Minister and is a co-founder of the Free Speech Union and author of numerous other books and papers whose proposals have become conservative policy, including, with Jacob Rees-Mogg, Raising the Roof: how to solve the United Kingdom’s housing crisis, on how the free-market can unleash beautiful housebuilding for everyone.

He has an MPhil from Cambridge University and a double-scholarship quantitative PhD from Imperial College London.
